Multiplication of 2 matrices.question: Consider a scenario where a bookstore offers seasonal discounts on two categories of books. During the winter sale, category A books are offered a 15% discount, and category B books receive a 5% discount. \newline (i) Define a matrix $D$ to represent the discounted prices such that when multiplied by a matrix $Q$, representing the original prices, the resulting matrix will give the actual prices after discounts for both categories. \newline (ii) If the original price matrix $Q$ is given as $\begin{bmatrix} q_1 \\ q_2 \end{bmatrix}$, where $q_1$ and $q_2$ are the original prices of category A and B books respectively, find the product $DQ$.
